newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Senate delegation heading for Asian talks.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Senate delegation heading for Asian talks.

text.p: A U.S. Senate delegation is to leave on a week-long trip to Asia on Saturday and will have high-level talks in China, Vietnam and Taiwan, Senate Democratic Leader Tom Daschle announced on Thursday.
In a letter to Daschle, a South Dakota Democrat, President Bill Clinton said the trip to China was an opportunity to advance the U.S. dialogue with Beijing and interests in the region.

Daschle will travel with Democratic senators Byron Dorgan of North Dakota, John Glenn of Ohio and Patrick Leahy of Vermont and Idaho Republican Dirk Kempthorne. California Democrat Dianne Feinstein will join the group for part of the itinerary.

Daschle said he planned to explore options for expanding agricultural and other exports from South Dakota. He said other issues included economic reforms, human rights, nuclear proliferation and the transition of Hong Kong to Chinese rule next year.
